lines.text: Super into it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a thought. There was something we used to do and sometimes I'd get hired to do in my town. A little bit of subterfuge. If we wanted to try and--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's gone real well for us in the past 24 hours, but go ahead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, this one's a little bit more under the surface.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Quiet subterfuge instead of loud subterfuge which is what we've been doing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In fact, quiet is the key. We used to do little whisper campaigns.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How so?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just going into bars, pubs. Start talking a little bit loudly about the pirate crew and Captain Jawgrasp and the hell that he unleashed on the docks the other night.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Disparage the dead's name so that when people--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck it, he's dead. Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And then when anyone finds out that we did it they'll be like, "Good for them for killing those "bastards," right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't even think we'd throw our name in the mix.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We don't ever mention ourselves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Never mention ourselves, just--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe the crew turned on their captain and killed him on the docks and fled with his ship, ja.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe whispering to some bartenders.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seems like it would take days.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, could you do this in a night?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, my thought was if we split up a little bit, you guys focus on hiring a crew, someone else focus on spreading some words.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could just sleep before all this stuff happens because damn!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure. Although the more time that passes, the longer word has to spread.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It probably has already spread.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, it's the middle of the night now, so it's not going to spread till morning. Right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about this point you look over in the horizon and you can see the faint hint of dark blue turning to lighter blue.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we just sleep? I'm so tired.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's take a nap. We'll just coast here. Can we coast? Do we have an anchor? Can we anchor?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're a little deep for an anchor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we just do doughnuts?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we go to sleep even if we're just sailing around?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure. Let's go in circles. 12 miles off coast, we'll just go in circles.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fjord, can the boat just be adrift if a couple of us stay up in shifts to make sure that there are no enemies?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In shifts, you can navigate in a pattern, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we slowly in shifts navigate towards a cove?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: None of us know how to steer this thing except for Fjord.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we just need to cool it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can very faintly see towards the horizon where Nicodranas is, the occasional little soft light of the lighthouse. You're not completely out of sight of it and when it's this dark and you pay attention, you can just barely see that little blip of light.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're going to see us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't have any light on here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's no light on the ship.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They'll see us when it gets lighter.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to go sleep, okay bye.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The plan is we're going to find a cove and hide the ship, sneak in, get some crew, sneak back. Or, we're just going to sail right into a different port also in Nicodranas? Grab a crew while we start a whisper campaign, and bolt?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. I don't know. Either one of those is fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sounds insane.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I vote for sailing up outside of the wharfmaster area, taking a little skiff in, just getting some crew and getting the fuck out of here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can always pull in the ship really fast to load on the crew and then peace out?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'd keep the ship out of there just in case the Zello, the Jello.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Zhelezo.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Zhelezo have come up and said (exaggerated accent) "There was a ship and the Fireball "detonated on the side of it and ours has a bunch of burn damage."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why are you talking so funny?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't-- The splinters are in my forehead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's sleep. So tired.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sit up with me for a little bit. We'll take the first shift.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you talking to me or--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You. Nott the Brave.

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Good night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys take shifts throughout the evening. To the early elements of the morning.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, late morning. Can I just take a moment with my goblin friend while they're sleeping?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come here, look. I want to show you something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want a piggyback?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Skitter up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (skittering)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You see the sun is coming up, but you can still see one or two up there. You see that one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The stars?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a planet, that one. That's another place.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, we're on the planet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Today was a major clusterfuck. Everything went wrong. We did all the wrong things.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It didn't feel very good, did it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. But do you know what worries me more is the feelings I'm getting from everyone in the crew. They're a little despondent. All of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do we do about that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know that it didn't go very well, but, this is our new family, right? We want the family to stick together. I think we need to-- oh you're over here. I think we need to lead by example.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You mean just laugh extra hard and pretend like we're having a great time?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keep their morale up, I think, is all I mean. We have done good things, I know that the day was-- it was a day. But we want this to keep going.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We care for these people, ja?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Absolutely. And we want to stay together, and if they're thinking that this is not working out, we have to do something to change that. I don't know about going in and starting to lie to a bunch of people. Is that going to make them--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We definitely need to think more than just wing it, you know? This group, we get under each others' skin, and we all egg each other on and we like to wing it, so maybe we need to slow things down. But I am serious, the thing that I am worried most is they feel like it's fracturing, and we cannot let that happen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I'll start thinking about what we can do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, are you mad about the swimming thing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, no, you did what you had to do! I needed to be with the group, otherwise I would've been stranded there alone, and that wouldn't have been good. Next time, you can just tell me, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tell you when I'm going to mess with your head a little bit?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's all right. I need it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought it would help.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It did, temporarily. I'm still very scared of the water, and I like being on the boat, but getting off is going to be a trick. But it's all right. Yeah. Yeah, we're cool. It's just these other people that're all messed up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispering) They're losing their cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know. We'll keep them together. If all else fails, fake a heart attack. Everyone will go to your aid, and then when they save you, we'll be like, "Yeah, we saved him, yeah!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know if you're joking or not, but I'm going to do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And there really is another world.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, we're on the world.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whoever's maintaining that, either advantage or you both roll independently.

lines.name: SAM, LIAM
lines.text: Independently.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a perception? 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right as dawn hits, a lot of these fisherman ships start going out and finding sections where lots of schools tend to come to feed. Beyond that, you don't see any encroaching danger.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there any distinct flags or colors hanging from our rigging?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have sails. There is a flag that sits at the top of the main mast, but it is currently tied up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Can I skitter up there and see what it is if it were to unfurl?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's big, so you'd have to unfurl to see it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I pull it down? Is there a thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can bring it down. You bring the flag down and open it up, and it's a light gray flag that looks almost like a curled wave. It looks like a wave of water that curls away. That's the best you can ascertain as to what the design means.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll ask Fjord about it when he wakes up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys finish your shift. Who's taking next shift?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll go second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On the crossover: Does this mean anything to you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does not.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It does not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe we should change it. On the next crossover, tell Jester to paint it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's going to be a giant dick and balls if we do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's taking next shift? It's Fjord, and just Fjord? Fjord and Caduceus out there for second shift.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How you doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I'm embracing the chaos.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. Yeah, that's a good way to deal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have a plan?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A plan?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're asking everyone. Oh no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a series of expectations, but I wouldn't call it a plan.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't get it, but okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm in pursuit of something, and I know what maybe the next couple of steps are, but past that--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's an answer. That'll do. Yesterday was-- oh god, what's the word?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Heavy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Heavy. Heavy's good. Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I take it you haven't seen much combat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I've fought animals, a few bandits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You ever fought a giant water genie?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. No, that was a first.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Me neither. Never even seen one before.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is life always this directionless?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Well, yeah, my new life, pretty much, yeah. It's open.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The one with the hair, I think she's going to take off again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yasha.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What makes you say that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, you know how it is. Some rocks don't sit right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Do you naturally have the ability to feel that out of people?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's very insightful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, my job for most of my life was to talk to people. Well, it wasn't to talk to people; it was to listen to people. I've listened to a lot of people.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: For your job?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. It's a graveyard. People come and they talk. A lot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: When they're grieving?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, and you listen a lot. I don't know much, but I know people. And I know things that aren't people. There's a lot more, apparently.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You seem to pick up on the stuff that's not said?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You have to. I like that you're looking for something. That's good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Otherwise, I don't really know what I'd be doing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I hope we find it, because then you'd get to figure out what to do next, and then there'll be two of us who would be wondering.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough. Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm definitely looking out on the ocean to see if--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, perception check from each of you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll give you advantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll do the double, yeah. Yeah, that's not bad. 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keeping an eye out on this as well, you, towards the end of your shift, notice one ship that isn't one of the fishermen ships or one of the traders' ships that you've seen in the docks and pointed out to you. It is one of the Zhelezo search ships. It's not leaving too far from the docks, but it's at least patrolling around the outskirts.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that a sign that maybe we should really leave?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we'll expand our travel pattern to skate out wider.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sometimes it's worth owning a mistake, and I think yesterday was a big mistake.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't necessarily want to own that here; they are very stern about mistakes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, by owning it, I mean stop trying to necessarily fix it, and let it be a mistake.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I agree with that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And maybe just--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Move on?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Admit that there might be no fixing this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think that's wise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ship does have a wide berth. It's only one ship that's going across the entire coast there, but that's one thing you've noticed. It's a danger.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Going to have some thoughts about that flag, too, but that's for tomorrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of you come to consciousness. It's now late morning, going to be approaching the afternoon fairly soon, but you've woken up, some food has been devoured, your cabin mate, Gallan, has come to consciousness, and has instinctually gone to start looking at the side of the boat and starting to repair bits of the Fireball damage you had left. Pulls out his tools, starts going to work on that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was good work.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Found a carpenter!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you guys want to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going back? Find a cove?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll make our way up to the docks where the wharfmaster is, which is a separate docks from where--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's the same city, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Same city. The Restless Wharf and the Open Quay are two large sections of docks on the north end.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Remember it took a while to walk from one to the other. And we're only taking the skiff in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus it was dark when we left, and nobody saw the--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And only people that don't look like us can take the skiff in to get the crew that we're going to look for.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know, couldn't the name of this boat be on a ledger or something somewhere?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What, The Mistake?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good thing we changed it to The Mistake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do know that when ships check into port-- you have not been in charge of it, but you've seen it-- usually there is a ledger of ownership or deed of ownership to the ship that the captain presents to the wharfmaster so that they can keep tabs on who comes in and comes out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we have one on this ship?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not for the Mistake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It got burned.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Guess what I can do! I can make things!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you've seen one before!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord can tell me what they look like.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can probably get the gist of it. Let's give it a shot. You can certainly try.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, let's try to forge a pink slip for the Mistake.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To Fjordie?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But also, "The Mist" is printed on the side of the boat. We have not changed that, have we?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've got to chip that off. Carpenter! First Mate!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hold your carpentry duties for now and go change the name of the ship.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay. To what?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Mistake! No one will know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Great."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In a different font.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I would love to help you, little goblin girl. However, I can't really write or read."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it painted on or is it chipped on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's painted on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can do that!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're an artist.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Back to your duties, please!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right." He goes back to repairs.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is the flag going to be a problem?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we don't have to unfurl it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But will they know what the flag looks like? Will that be part of the information that exists about the ship?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am an actor in real life, you should probably ask Matt.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Which is why I'm asking you and hoping you make eye contact with the game--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you know, they don't check the sails. The sails are designed to show allegiance to certain areas. If, for whatever reason, the ship was searched and a sail was found that perhaps was known to be not kosher with the laws of the coast, then that would be a problem. But that's only if the sail itself is--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But the flag, is it possible someone might recognize the flag?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's possible. You probably wouldn't want to go into port with the flag unfurled.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They don't even have to board us, because we're going to stay out in the river. We're just taking the skiff in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe burn the flag?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could dye it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How about we get into the docks first so we can get some crew?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'll rewrite the name, at least, on the side of the ship.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. In order to do so, you'll have to dangle from the actual stern of the ship.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha, hold my ankles!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha looks confused. "Okay, I guess," and turns you over and holds you off the side. (straining) Yasha's even having to wedge against the side because to get you further enough down, it's about ten feet from the stern, so Yasha's having to get her foot caught up underneath the railing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Keep doing this motion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jeez.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm holding paint!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, this is the paint can upside-down...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes!
