lines.text: Find that navigator. Did we find the rest?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intelligence check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14? Okay. You have met one navigator before.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasp) I remember!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I do not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was it Orly?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think it was Orly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Was it within the last month? Then you have to tell me who it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's what I did, it's Orly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She said Orly, you didn't confirm it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I was waiting to see if you'd pick up on it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh. That's going to cost you. Caduceus' intelligence just went to eight.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ugh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go get Orly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's in the other port.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's all right, go get them. We don't look like ourselves.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we'll walk there. We need turtle power.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How long is the walk?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From here? I'd say-- Carefully? About an hour.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: An hour. We'd have to re-spellify ourselves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can send a message to him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! How do you send a message to him? You mean, like, spell Message?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's not going to respond to that!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If there's money involved.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, hold on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Think hard about this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is a powerful spell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Offer money from the get-go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come to Open Quay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come to The Mistake in the Open Quay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lose all the thes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come to Mistake in Open Quay. We've got money for you as a navigator.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Job opportunity.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You still have more words.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Should we say, "We're The Mighty Nein, we met you the other night"? No, maybe not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why do we know that he likes or hangs out with?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Marius.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, we can say "Marius needs help. Come to Open Quay--"

lines.name: LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No? Shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just say, your messages, you put it: Your friends from the other night. That's it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dear Orly--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the first two. Go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everybody else is too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come to Open Quay. The Mistake will hire you as a navigator. Lots o'money. That's one word.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (uncertain groan)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: O'money. Of money. Okay. Lots of money. No, no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, I know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How many words do I have left?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that 17 that she's--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, eight left.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eight left?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come now. Also, The Mistake is a boat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come now. Also, The Mistake is a boat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. There's a brief pause, and eventually, you hear this voice come through, "I'll swing on "over. Soon as I m-m-muster the energy to finish my breakfast."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's coming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Little time passes, and sauntering up onto the dock, you see the massive, waddling form of the tortle, with the sack over the shoulder. The rest of the deckhands look and give a nod. Some recognize him, others are still like, "Fucking tortles, they're weird." Then eventually makes his way to the ship, over to the skiff and goes-- Oh no, you guys have the ship in dock. You brought it all in there. He walks over and steps up onto the gangplank. "So whom-- who am I talking to?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Me, apparently.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I heard from some m-m-mysterious magic voice that "you were going to hire someone to navigate."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We were hoping your services weren't spoken for.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How long you looking to need m-m-me?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Few weeks? At the most, maybe only a couple.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you know who you're talking to? We all look different from the last time that we have met.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have no idea."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We came to see you, we talked about that we-- a man named--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shush, just let him get on the boat before we tell him these things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We like the look of you. We have a good job and big money.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm m-m-mighty confused, but money definitely drives, so."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How much do you charge on a weekly rate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Weekly, let me think. 35 gold?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (shouting) A week?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A week.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A week, yeah, it's--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We might be gone a month or two.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I have 20 gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 27 gold a week.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How are we going to get enough gold to pay all of these people?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's literally our only job candidate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Deal, if I get to choose my quarters."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Choose your quarters?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "M-m-my quarters."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We can accommodate that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then, m-m-my friend, it's a deal." (laughter) Begins walking up the gangplank and then inflates the bag and (bagpipe sounds) announces his presence onto the ship as he arrives.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're trying to be quiet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A full Scottish send off when we leave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You know, the more you hear it, the more you're like, "Eh, it's not that bad, "actually." It's the initial note that kicks in and once you get used to it, it's not bad.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It breathes better in open space.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. All right, with your crew and supplies acquired and--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We did it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- possible seeds of whispers disseminated, some information gained about the scenario of those that you killed on the dock the night before, and the knowledge that they're still searching for the rest of the crew, you make your way off the dock. Are you going to try and pass by the Zhelezo ship once more? Because you're going to have to to make your way out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well then, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I assist him with counting as they go by?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, with Orly hired and helping you out with this. Did you tell Orly you were trying to avoid that ship?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Orly goes, "I think this helps me know what kind of business we into." Okay, with advantage on that. Nice, all right. Quickly telling you, "All right, go now, round about that way," he begins giving you the proper timing and based on your previous information, without issue you manage to dodge the Zhelezo ship, make your way to open waters and now, in the later afternoon, you guys have now exited the outskirts of Nicodranas. We'll see how much of what you've left behind helps to what you left behind the night before, but nevertheless you have a crew, you have supplies, and you are on the water. With that, we're going to go ahead and take a break.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nice, nice, nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hired the tortle!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just keep him around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to hear you do that voice forever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right, not only does he keep coming back from the dead, he also wins dice trays. Goku, you won this awesome tray. We'll get that sent out to you ASAP, we'll get your info. Congratulations, and well done. Picking up where we left off, as Orly is on the ship, Orly also brings with him a map of the Menagerie Coast. Because USPS is the fucking worst--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Please sponsor our show. Please sponsor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- it did not arrive in time, the full one, so you'll have to deal with this printout for the time being, but there is one on the way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How big was the full one going to be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. Next week, possibly at the live show. There we go. That can be something for you to reference for your travels on the Menagerie Coast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I keep sharpening it, and it's just shit--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Rose gold.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (regular accent) I'm wearing an Apple watch with a rose gold band on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, Sam.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mine and Matt's wedding rings are rose gold.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (Russian accent) It is the best color.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a pretty packed ship for a runner ship, because you have a full crew, and then on top of that, you have you guys. As opposed to training as sailors, you've hired more on top of what you have, so now you have a very busy ship. However, you are out and about on the ocean. What are you guys going to do, where are you going, what's the plan? Orly needs something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, we've got to show-- maybe this jogs Orly's memory. Orly-- why am I showing this to you, but here, here's a piece of a map we retrieved! We'd like to go there. But keep it secret from the rest of the crew.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that the Inky Claw Reef?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He compares it with the map and goes, "B-b-est I can tell, it's probably close to the "Inky Claw, you know?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, you were right, Fjord!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're off the boat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Take your gold and leave.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why do they call it the Inky Claw?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why do they call it the Inky Claw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you know, partially because the waters around there are very murky and very dark, so it's hard to see where the reef comes close to the surface. A lot of the sea creatures that live in the area tend to knock a lot of the silt up, that's close to the bottom of the reef, which means sometimes the reef sneaks up on you and rakes across the bottom of the ship itself.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We still need to follow the trade routes, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It also means that sometimes, as you've heard, certain creatures that live in the ocean or nearby, you're a little more susceptible to, but it's a quicker route if where you're heading is the Inky Claw?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roads. It's just like roads. Off roading it or roading it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I mean, it looks like there's not a main trade route.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, if we stay on the trade route, we have to go here, and then down, and then come across, or we go here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's off-road it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As the crow swims.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughs) As the crow swims?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) Do crows swim?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're telling Orly to head to where?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I want to make everyone aware of the dangers, okay. If we take the trade route, it will take three and a half times longer to get there than if we just go from Point A to Point B. But Point A goes across uncharted waters, and on this map there are giant tentacles coming out of the water, probably just for flavor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I told you, sea monsters!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could just be artist's interpretation, to try and fill in blank space, doesn't mean anything.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's tentacles on the map?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't tell anything about what's happening here. Port Damali. Nicodranas.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nicodranas, and the Inkclaw is down to your lower right hand corner.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those could just be vines.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Literally can't tell what that is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sea vines.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're like little sea cucumbers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: TGIF flair, is all that is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We also have this map, which is at the top of the Inkclaw Reef, that will guide us through the reef. Instead of coming this direction and then down and underneath, which is what you would probably be doing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's do it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. We'll instruct Orly--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not only will we do it, we will do it in solidarity with you and your quest, because we are a team! A cohesive unit that acts as one! When one member wants something, we all want something, right guys?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, of course. We are The Mighty Nein, not to be trifled with. Welcome to The Mighty Nein, Caduceus.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Put it in!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Put what in? The map?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, she means your hands.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Both hands, or just one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And Yasha!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha puts one hand in as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On three, ocean. One, two, three!

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Ocean!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that a goblin thing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Now it's a--

lines.name: LAURA, SAM
lines.text: It's a Mighty Nein thing!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah! We have a thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a new thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to instruct Orly to navigate from north to south to the top of the reef, using this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Orly corresponds and is like, "Just out of personal curiosity, why are we heading through the "reef? Where are we going?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We are trying to catch up with a captain that we need to make contact with.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Well, this captain you're talking about m-m-may be where that 'X' is on the paper?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think they might, yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So that's putting us right by the island."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Which island?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He points to, just on the outskirts of the 'X', the land mass.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that island.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "According to my map right here, that is Urukayxl."

lines.name: TRAVIS, SAM
lines.text: Urukayxl?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I see it, yes, I see this map.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's a real avoided locale."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Superstition. Many folks around here, they talk about the dark stories of dense jungle and "very dangerous, iron-bearing creatures. They talk of strange, ancient m-m-masses, and they talk of "wild, unnatural types."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could it just be talk? For instance, there is a rumor of a ghost girl on the docks back in the Menagerie Coast we heard circulating.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not too familiar with that one, but it's possible. Mind you, I'm the navigator, I ain't "getting off the ship, so that's all up to you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you ever heard of the Silver Silt Palace?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Can't say I have."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, just checking.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caduceus, are you excited about these haunted stories?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, I guess, I don't know. I hadn't really thought about it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey look, it could be the path leading us to more dead people, yeah?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I guess. I don't know, I'm trying to reevaluate my expectations, I suppose. But we have a direction, we have a place to go, and stories are stories.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This thing that you want to do, this mission-- I'm sorry, I overheard last night-- is there a place that it needs to happen, or is it something that you will do wherever you go on the road?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I didn't really think it through, I hadn't really-- I thought it would be easier to figure out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caduceus, do you actually even know what you're looking for?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A sign.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you came with us because we thought we were a sign?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And now you're looking for the next sign.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, when you say it out loud--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whereas he still hasn't found what he's looking for.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you trust in your visions?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did. I-- yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And you have strong faith in this thing you follow?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then if you ever go off the path, maybe they'll tell you. You just have to keep looking."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, that's fair. I hadn't really thought about that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's kind of new to myself as well."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're heading towards an island. I've heard stories. Let's go to the island.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: When we fully get out of the reach of the land, by the way, as we're sailing away, I just want to keep an eye out on the horizon and be like: Professor! See if I see him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I throw some dead pigeon or seagull in the air.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Never has there been a more worthless perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nope. Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No sign of the Professor. You do have-- what is it, Sprinkle? Sprinkle is still nestled up next to you. However your blink puppy, Nugget, still remains with Marion back in Nicodranas.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to send a message to her before we go to sleep tonight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To Nugget or your mom?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To my mama.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right. The evening comes quick; by the time you guys are leaving, it's not that far from dusk, and so your first evening out on your new trajectory, you have time. What do you want to send to Marion?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mama, stuff happened at the docks and we had to leave very quickly. Please take care of Nugget for a while. We'll be back, I promise. You may have heard about the little girl who was killing herself on the dock--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you using this across multiple spells?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, this is my second message. My second message: that looked like me but it wasn't me, don't worry, I'm very much alive, and I love you very much, and I'll be home soon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Beep!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the evening, who's watch? Okay. And you have crew who can take up as well, if you want to. So one of you or both of you, make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Want both of us to do it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure. Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15? Okay. During the evening, you keep an eye on the waves. At some point, the moon itself is starting to find itself low in the sky, and you look over and you see this faint glow in the water below. You feel the back of your neck get warm for a second and you glance over to try and inspect what the source of this light is. It's a jellyfish bloom. You see hundreds and hundreds of these tiny jellyfish below the surface that are giving this faint bioluminescent blues and pinks and variety of colors in that pastel spectrum. They pass under the waves as you move by and you look out beyond that and you can see a few more. For the next hour or so, you look over the water and pass by these beautiful little beacons of color in the middle of this dark black ocean.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord, have you ever seen anything like this before?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, they're beautiful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I've never seen anything like this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Last thing you want to is jump in there, though. That is a bad time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, jellyfish sting and it's quite painful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sometimes things that are the most beautiful are the things that can hurt you the worst. Are you worried about where we're going?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. No, I'm more anxious to get there. My curiosity, I suppose, overrides my fear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's good. You're not afraid that this captain is going to hurt you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus, I have the sphere. Captain Avantika doesn't.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I feel like we take care of ourselves pretty well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I promise I'll heal you if you start to hurt, okay?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're welcome. Do you ever get sad?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sad?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that sometimes things don't work out the way you were hoping?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I suppose I get sad. Are you sad, Jester?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Only sometimes, but it passes really quickly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sometimes sad about the things that I had before, that I won't have anymore. I sometimes wish that things were different. What makes you sad?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I miss my mama already. I thought we could see her longer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am sorry that we left in the way that we did. Would your mom ever think of leaving Nicodranas?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know. She thought about it one time with my dad. She was planning to leave with him, but then he never came back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. What would you want for her? To stay there and grow old or--?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would like for her to be happy. I would like for him to love her. I don't know. I would like for her to not have to work anymore.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's very noble of you. Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm pretty noble.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, how about on some of these islands I've heard that there is treasure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh really?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hard to find. I'm not making any promises, but if we play our cards right and we take care of each other, we might return a bit wealthier than we left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is a pretty good plan. Then we can use that money to bribe The Gentleman to go back and woo my mama again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or give it to your mom and have her go find The Gentleman, but she's just amazing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That could work, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Don't be sad. Your mom is very proud of you, that much was clear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Thanks, Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't mention it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a bit of like a, "Damn, now I'm glad I agreed to this journey." They take some food and a couple of them are like--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They decided not to kill us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mutiny!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There are vegetarian options as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: "Wow, this quinoa's pretty good!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's all I wanted, I can die happy now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hilariously, Marius is actually a vegetarian.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Perfect.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Of course he is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is! He's like, "I'll probably partake in that, too, if that's all right?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is delicious."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Family recipe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They're crazy, aren't they?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Completely crazy. Bonkers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's going to happen, are they going to let me go, you think?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, I'm just barely attached on to this at this point, but I think you're fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If worst comes to worst, we cut and run, huh? You and me?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Worst comes to worst, I'll make sure you can cut and run. I think I'm stuck here for a while, but I'll make sure you can bugger out if you need to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay, thanks."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Once again, very good."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have no idea what just happened.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Continuing on your journey, who's keeping watch for this next day?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so either you guys roll individually or one of you with advantage, your choice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Individually, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Perception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice. Solid.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17? Okay, good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Marisha, you have to give $100 to 826LA.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, can you imagine? We would be so broke.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Every time we roll a one, we have to donate $100 from our own wallets.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, since Orly is the navigator, helping you out and are you leading this-- are you guiding the boat, are you the captain of this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're the captain, just take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You didn't hire a captain and they need to be hired by somebody, so one of you needs to be the captain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're the captain. Captain Fjord!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You generally don't hire a captain for the ship, like hey, we're just a bunch of assholes with a boat! We need to hire someone to be our leader and pay us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I saw, right next to the cut your own keys booth next to the dock, there was a rent-a-captain. He would sit there with a corncob pipe and he's like, "Argh, me is a--"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You didn't download the app, though, didn't you, so you didn't hire him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's just a photo opportunity.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your captain name, to your crew?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My captain name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They need to have to know who their captain is, who they're going to go towards.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Captain... Captain Tusktooth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Captain Tusktooth. There we go. They're very confused because there are no tusks visible on Tusktooth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope. You never want to see them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good to know, Captain Tusktooth. All righty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The perception check was for at night during a shift?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, this was throughout the day.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All throughout the whole day, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The crew's keeping watch, too, but this is keen eyes and occasionally going up to-- climbing the sail a bit to get a good view, or climbing the mast to keep an eye out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm leaning on the edge and I just go: Caleb, this is boring. It's just blue.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm blue!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jester's more interesting to look at.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a survival check with advantage for Orly's help as the navigator. To keep us on task and in the proper direction.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could we say that Beau and--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to pick up some speed, actually.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Look at Fjord. He is the captain now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Captain Tusktooth already, out of the gate, acting like a captain and the crew's coming together. For all of you who watched the fuckery that was you trying to get out and then back to port the night before, seeing a full crew on the ship knowing what they're doing, you're like "Oh." Yeah. It's probably good you hired this crew.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Lower the inboard motor! Fire at--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One quick thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, I want to thank you. You could have told any of these people anything about me and you have not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. Don't give me that much credit yet, I still could.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know. You have every right to. I hope you don't. I don't know how all of them would handle it. Be that as it may, I have something for you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He weighs one ounce.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really, one ounce?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like the famous little owl with the star eyes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is a loaner.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can have him for roughly a week.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He doesn't look as angry as Professor Thaddeus.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I place him. He's going to listen to you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is he?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I poke him and see if he bites me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Every time!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everything that I touch!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: One ounce! One inch punch!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is technically a monk weapon, the index finger.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My hands are registered weapons!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A couple rules. He will listen to you. Will you listen, Frumpkin? Frumpkin nods. Okay. If you need to get him out of danger in a hurry, you say "split." That's what it will take. You'll need me to bring him back, but if he's in danger and you want to keep him for your week loaner, you say split. Okay? He's yours. Thank you. Yeah?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, Caleb. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing really catches your attention; it's just open shores and open waters. Since you're off the trade route path, there don't appear to be any other ships passing back and forth. It feels comforting to be so alone in some ways, but for some of you, it's strangely isolating. There may be a few moments throughout the next few days where you have to go below deck and not conjecture, you especially, Caduceus. This is--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm good in my head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Day two and day three start getting a little hard on you to-- we've been traveling for 48 hours and literally everything looks exactly the same.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to start probably talking to fish at some point in the near future.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. For the evening's watch on the second day, or this is technically the end of the first day.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take a watch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you guys roll for your perception.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Six-- nine!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15, okay. You continue on through the evening, uneventful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Want any booze? Oh, you don't drink.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't drink.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mind if I drink?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not at all.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Out of idle curiosity, why have you been trying to butter me up?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because even though we've made some mistakes and we'll probably continue to, it feels like we're a little bit better when we're together. This other fellow in the group, Mollymauk, he sort of showed us that... by dying. I'm just trying to keep us together.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We all have our own things, right? I'm sure you have your own thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do, and for the record, I'm on board for now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll keep your boy safe, that's okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You stick with Caleb.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not an only child; I'm aware of how this works.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. You have sisters and brothers?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's right, you told us. You had a large family, but they're all scattered about, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're somewhere, I suppose.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are they trying to save your town? Is it a town? Is it your home?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's just the temple ground, that's all there is to it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're out there trying to find a solution for whatever ails it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's why they left, yeah. That was the thought.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've had no contact with them?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. I was the last one left.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I hope no one breaks in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I've resigned myself to the thought that it's entirely possible that someone will.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not a religious lady, but I will tell you that, for me, this journey with this group has been a bit of a sign. I know that you're questioning whether it was for you, but--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What kind of sign?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A sign that there could be, for all of us, another chapter.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Never mind. All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to drink now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't have to take every shift, but you have to rely on your crew to keep a watch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: NPCs!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Any plans for the evening?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take the last watch. Is it at night at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be night, yeah. You've been captaining the ship for a full day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Before I go to sleep, I'm going to politely ask any of the fish and things that are in the ocean to let us know if there's trouble up ahead. If they would be so kind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You get the sense that the fish would be happy to, as they--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm a lunatic aren't I? There's just no--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's great.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, because I have a roll for this, but I'm okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You lean over the side of the boat and, talking to the fish that pass by-- you get the sense that it's like, (chorus of fish) "Sure." (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can talk to them, but they can't talk back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're nowhere near as fast as the ship, so within the sphere of perception that a fish has, the ones that are now far behind you will definitely let you know when you come across something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. And I love playing that element.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (as a fish) Nice boat!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll hand off the wheel to someone and I'll go down to the side of the ship and I'll summon the falchion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With not a lot of people on the deck paying attention, hopefully, can I reach over the side and dip the tip of the sword into the ocean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. It drags through the water like any other blade would.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does the eye do anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it doesn't react.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. I'll summon it back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Falchion's back whence it came.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (quietly) From whence it came.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you keeping watch?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check for me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, nothing for the evening. Okay. As you're focusing on your blade on the side of the boat, as it gets close to midnight-- let me actually roll for the crew as well. Nope, okay. As you are checking your blade and looking around, you hear this sound that catches your ear. It's like (rustling), but it's up. Glancing up to the left of your vision, and there's a shape that's sitting up on one of the sails.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What the fuck? What is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just a dark shape sitting up there on the sail.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Professor Thaddeus?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not moving.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: It's so spooky.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whistle) I'll sound a general alarm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you whistle, you see it has two wings, and it-- and takes off into the dark night.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is it? What's going on?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There was something that took off from the mast; it had wings.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was it a parrot? I hear there's parrots on pirate ships.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was pretty large, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looked humanoid-ish.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Humanoid-ish?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You saw big wings and you saw legs dangling. It looked like a bird, but it was human-sized.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where is Yasha? I go down; is Yasha still sleeping, or is Yasha still here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha's asleep. You go down and Yasha sits up. As soon as you enter the room, the chamber that Yasha has--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (shouting) Yasha, are you still here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Before you even get to that point, the sound of the door opening, Yasha's like-- (panting).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (shouting) Yasha's still here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Be careful, Beau." Puts the blade and leans it against the side of the cot and leans back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fjord saw a thing with two wings, appeared to be humanoid, flying off the boat, and just wanted to make sure--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grabs the sword and gets back up and walks past you and up the stairs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (shouting) Yasha's coming.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What the fuck was it, Fjord?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know. I didn't see, it's too dark.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to turn around and do a scan of the horizon. Do I see anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check, with disadvantage, because this is looking into far darkness.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll put my goggles on just in casies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just in casies, sure. But still at disadvantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nine. Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing out, it looks like-- at this point, the moon is just starting to vanish in the distance, so there's not a lot of light, and it looks like a black, endless void around the ship with just a faint image of a blue line as a horizon in all directions.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I climb up to where it was and see if it left anything behind?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS, SAM
lines.text: Like some poop.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like poop, or a feather, or--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You make your way up. Go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A wallet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look, personal identification.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look and you can see-- it's dry, weathered wood; this mast has been in use for a while. You do see what appear to be some grooves, like large talons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It had claws.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh hey. Rub a little phosphorus on and-- send a globule of light 120 feet in every direction from the boat, four of them, to see if there's anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As the lights drift out, at that moment, you watch as a series of shapes swoop in (squawking). In that instant, you watch as a cluster of harpies-- not coming towards you-- are now coming in and dive-bombing the sails. They're rushing in and trying to drag their claws through to put you dead in the water. From a narrative standpoint, go ahead and roll initiative.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jesus.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, oh no. Laura asks a good question.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was last campaign, Travis said.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here's my boots.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. 25 to 20?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, do you want someone to roll for Yasha?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Matt'll do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that's a 16.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa, best roll ever.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's because Ashley's not here to roll initiative for herself. 20 for Beau.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are we doing 25 to 20 still?

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've been doing therapy talks for two and a half hours, Matt has to wake up now. We're on combat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. 20 for Beau. 20 to 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ooh, look at that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There we are.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yasha had 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. Jester, Caduceus, Yasha. 15 to ten?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nein. Oh no, I was saying no in German, excuse me. I did not roll a nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott, Fjord, and then Caleb, you're last?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja. Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Harpies rolled a natural 20 on their initiative roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not hired to fight, and they go charging into the cabin below. They're both looking towards the guys who are running and they're both going to swoop down and see if they can go over to the deckhands.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have they already slashed the sails?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! Not our crew!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that's a hit. That's a hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fucker.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a miss. One of them attempts to try and grab towards the sail, but the way the wind is blowing, it can't actually get a hold of it and only does a slight tear on the side. The other two, however, with their claws-- seven, 13 points of damage to that sail. You hear the tearing sound as they both drag a series of open tears across the central sail on the main mast. You watch as the sail-- (flapping) the ship's starting to slow a little bit in that process. The one that lands in the back of the ship stops, wings out, inhales, and this voice begins to emerge, this strange, baleful-- (singing)-- this weird, ghostly voice that seems to emanate and then grow into its own chorus-- it's like a dirge, almost-- as it spreads out into the space. I need everybody to make a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh. Not my strength.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a success.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Success.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Success.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 15 plus--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys watch as Nott's arms drop, her weapon going limp to her side, her head turned slightly towards one shoulder and smiling, listening to this song. One of the crew that's not currently being held by the harpy almost makes it into the lower cabin, and then stops dead in his grasp and is also entranced by the song. The harpy continues to sing. All right, Beau, you're up first.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: With a quick glance, does it look like the sail is worth trying to save any further, or is it fucked? Just with a quick glance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the sail is not completely destroyed, and it could be repaired, should they not continue to pull it apart.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They look like they're still going for it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to run over and try and collapse the sail. So it's not unfurled, try and collapse it? I don't know if that's the right call.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can give it a shot. All right. You have done a little bit of sail work. I'd say make a quick intelligence check. Having not been formally trained, necessarily, we'll see if you can--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, in your time on the ship and studying how the different elements of the ship maneuver together to create motion and riding the wind, you figure out that one of the various ropes you pull and release and will cause the sail to entirely come down, or you could just pull it up and cause it to no longer be unfurled.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whatever's quickest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably pull it in. You grab the rope and pull it up. Both the harpies are curving around for another series of attacks on it, but you're pulling that element of the sail up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I take a bonus action to do Patient Defense after I do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can. Your arm holds the rope in place and you get yourself ready in case anything happens. That finishes your go. Jester, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to cast Spiritual Weapon as my bonus action right above the singing harpy and try to slam it down upon her head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What-- that-- I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was exciting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like that shouldn't count, but whatever. That is a 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not very hard to hit. They don't have a lot of armor, if at all. They're more just a little dexterous, but other than that-- you see these harpy forms. You see these humanoid female lithe bodies, naked, but their legs curl into these taloned, hawk-like feet. They have these sets of wings that come off of it, and their long stringy hair. Their faces are little--it goes beautiful to grotesque where the mouth itself seem almost like the lips are shrunk and shriveled, and series of sharpened, broken teeth are visible from where they open their mouth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 12 damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then, I'm going to use my action to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Action surge!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To cast Toll the Dead right over her head! And ring a bell right across it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. What is--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wisdom saving throw of 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural one. No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! That's 2d12.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (like Sesame Street's The Count) A two, a D, a 12. Ah, ah, ah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seven points of damage. Ah, ah, ah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the impact of the spiritual weapon, the large spinning lollipop cracking into her face. The song stops for a second, and the blast of divine energy in the middle of her head sets her off, but she pushes through and continues the song. Looks pretty hurt and is wondering what to do next. That finishes your turn, Jester?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I guess. I'm on the sail, right? I'm on the top?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you're up at the top looking down, and the two harpies that are spinning back, they definitely noticed you casting these spells.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I hold on? Can I grab onto rope or anything? Or is that like an action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can try to reach for something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could I consider my movement to like reach down and hold onto like--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say you hold onto a rope, sure. That'll be your movement. Okay, that finishes Jester's turn. Caduceus?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: First thing I'm going to do is I'm going to cast-- I'm going to get myself into a reasonable position and I'm going to cast-- where did it go? There it is. Calm Emotions. In theory, if this is a charm spell, and this counts as a charm if I'm correct, you can just fail a charisma save, if you'd like.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? How does this-- Huh? Who?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you attempting to do here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to use Calm Emotions to negate the charmed effect on Nott, and anybody within 20 feet of me. Actually, anyone within 20 feet of it. I'm going to run a few feet away from you, I'm going to take my staff and I'm going to pull piece of silverware and bang that crystal. It's going to make a dissonant sound and wakey-wakey.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will say, because technically--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Charisma saving throw a creatures can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well no, there is no saving throw if they're suppressing it. So it just happens. Suddenly, the song that's entrancing you, you shake out of it as Caduceus finishes muttering this phrase and you feel the clarity come to your mind once more.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was awesome.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've got work to do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This also affects the other deckhands.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, so I'm just basically disrupting that song as long as it's within a certain range for about a minute. I'm also going to use my bonus action to wake up the bugs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The mass of winged beetles begin to clatter out in a cloud.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The one that's singing, I'm going to roll it towards the lollipop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. They rush in there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Snack time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an attack. It's a d20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that'll definitely hit. That is 2d--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I got to fix this at some point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I'll make a print out. Remind me to make a print out for you since this is having a hard time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know. We just haven't had time to fix anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why not?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it is 4d4.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's right. That's ooh! 15 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 points of damage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Beetle damage!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't even know what just happened.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caduceus is back!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The beetles are now swarming this harpy who's taken bludgeoning. It is now bleeding profusely, and you can only see part of her torso and she's like (screeching). The song is dropped, and now is trying to fly away as she's picking up her wings, as these beetles are now tearing into her flesh. That ends your turn, Caduceus?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha's turn. There's the two that are up on top, darting down to pick up the guy. The one that's currently holding the other deckhand, Yasha's going to rush forward, since it's technically within her melee range. She's going to rush forward and take two strikes. If someone wants to roll for her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope, that's not a d20. A ten and a one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. The ten hits, the one does not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sure some stuff was added to the ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. No, it's 3d6 actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah! Teamwork!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Six!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My rolls were better!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Your rolls would've been better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Great, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You rolled a one on your hit. We both suck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The harpy still holds onto the deckhand, but is unable to make a drop. This brings us to Nott and Fjord.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is anyone in melee range with anyone else?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, there is the one holding the deckhand that Yasha just attacked.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to shoot at that one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sneak attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not very armored or dexterous creatures.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 18 points of damage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 points of damage, nice. Blasts! You see it has to right itself, she's flapping her wings, but still holding on and trying now desperately to just get away. There's no attempt to interface; she has her quarry and is about to bolt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fire again, bonus action!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kill it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, not good. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 just hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 11 hits!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hits! Whoa! No sneak attack. Eight points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it's flying away, it gets about ten or so feet up, and the deckhand is screaming "Ah! Help me!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've got you, nameless deckhand!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The bolt hits it, spins in the air, a cluster of feathers, then slams down hard on the deck of the ship. The deckhand also hits, and rolls, and hits the side of the ladder that leads up to the poop deck. He's like (groaning) and now starting to freak out looking at the other harpies that are circling. There's still five of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll use my movement to run over to the deckhand and be like: You're okay now!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're fine!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Fjord?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll aim two Eldritch Blasts up at one of the two harpies that's flying up above the mast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 19 on the first one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And the second one is, ooh, 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is-- oh shit, where is the 1d10? Ten!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten points of damage on the first one--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope, no! Sorry, I was calling that out like an idiot. 11 points of damage on the first one, and seven points of damage on the second one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You turn around, glancing up at them, release that one blast of eldritch energy that crackles and spins, slamming into each of them up in the air, and lights up the sky above the mast. You can see through the diffusing of the impacts behind the sails on the opposite side of the deck, for those of you on the other end of the ship. As both of them spin into a circle, taking pain from the impact, but then right themselves, looking down to the source of this angry, aggressive act.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That brings us to Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far up the mast could you say I could climb with my movement? Is that half speed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With your movement, it would be half speed and I'd say, for you, who's not a necessarily an accomplished climber, it would be an athletics check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Necessarily an "accomplished climber."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Indoor kid.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How high does the mast go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The mast would go up probably 25, 30 feet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nevermind. I will stand at the mast and I will pull a white feather out of my coat and trace a baleful glyph in the air and cast Fear, and they must make a wisdom saving at 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Anything within 30 feet of Caleb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything within 30 feet of Caleb?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Anything?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Enemies.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would get three of them. The one that failed to grab the other guy is just out of range.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's only three left, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's five left, technically.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I thought there were only five?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There were six--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There were six total. One's died, one of them's close to death, and there are two wounded, and two that have been untouched.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, the song broke, it didn't die.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 16 wisdom save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that ends your turn, Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Back to the top of the round, harpies. Those two harpies full dash, full run, go spinning back in the direction they came. As far away from you as they can get.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Auf Wiedersehen!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those two, for the time being, are out of the way. Let's see if they can make their save. Nope!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They have to be out of line of sight. If they can see there's me on the boat--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's true, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what the spell says.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, facing away doesn't matter. Yeah, no, they're still running.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: See ya!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's its turn. Let's see, the other two are going to go ahead-- Two are fleeing. That's fleeing. Oh, there's only one that's free. That one is going to attempt to attack one of the other sails because there's multiple sails up at that point. A smaller one. You know what? No, it's going to come after you since you're the one that's holding the sail. It's going to swoop down and attack you with claws.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come at me, bitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a-- actually surprising, an 18.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Miss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think that misses you. Oh, it's at disadvantage, too, because you have your--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Patient Defense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Second attack. Yeah, misses with both.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You motherfucker.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to attempt to move 15 feet away from you with the rest of its movement.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pop!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Make an attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Punch attack!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Didn't we say we weren't going to try and solve things with fists?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, let's talk it out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's all I have!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (cawing)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 13. I believe that hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that hits.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is unarmed, ooh, ten total!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Max damage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It gets dragged down and thrust down on the edge of the railing and crack a rib, and it's trying to get out of your grasp and it manages to pull free, but now is right there next to you. Couldn't get much further. You get the sense now that they're retreating. This was a quick harrying. They didn't expect quite so much resistance, and most of them are wanting to get the hell out. With that knowledge, Beau, it's your turn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to use the rope that I'm holding onto, and I'm going to use that to lift myself up and do like a little swinging double-kick action to this harpy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I love it. Go ahead and make your two attacks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a 16 and a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's correct. Go ahead and roll damage for each.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bop bop!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pop pop. For both of them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, high rolls!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Eight plus five is 13 plus another six is 19.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oof.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 points of damage. Both kicks (whack whack) to the harpy as she's trying to get back up on the air; ends up knocking her back onto the deck. (angry crowing)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Still up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still up and is now is going to continue to try and make an escape.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pop.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, Beauregard!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let me roll for two attacks. Okay, that is 14 for one and a natural 19 for the other.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, roll damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten damage total?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch the tension of the sail as it unfurls and snaps the neck of the harpy and drags her up and is now dangling from the rope as the sail is now unfurled again, still torn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you do that on purpose?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wind physics.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was better results than I expected.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Always say yes!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes up Beau's turn. Jester, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to use my spiritual weapon to send it to the harpy that is trying to get that guy off the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nine plus seven, it hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Eight points of damage to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was the first time that it's been wounded. It gets hit by the large, spiritual lollipop as it's trying to carry off the deckhand, still holding on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think I'm going to use Guiding Bolt on the one that was flying away that was singing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it. It's quite a ways away and you can see it (flapping).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I get 120 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, definitely within 120 feet, so go ahead and roll for the attack on that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Level one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, level one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks pretty hurt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know what I add to it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It should be right above.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's an 18, I get 18 plus whatever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's your spell attack bonus. The same as your spiritual weapon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay plus seven. It's good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, come on. Seven points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven points of damage. As you bring the spiritual weapon down, you turn to see the other one flying away. You release the bolt of vibrant, radiant energy. It streaks off right as it's flying, heading it off. You quickly aim, watching its arc and as it flies away (impact) (screeching). You watch this burst of light as its body tumbles and sploosh into the ocean water below. Jester, that finishes your turn. Caduceus, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure. Yeah. There's one that's trying to get away with one of our deckhands?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, it's been hit once.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. I'm just going to nuts and bolts this. I don't suppose my insect swarm can attack for a bonus action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It can't get close enough, unfortunately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It can move closer, but it's not going to--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I guess I'll do a Guiding Bolt at level three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I just saw you that. I'm like: Ah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that's 19, so that's 6d6.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Damn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caduceus, looking at the swarm, turns around, holds the staff in the air towards the one taking off with one of your deckhands and when you saw the bright beam--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 16 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ooh! Spins around and releases a far heavier and brighter burst of light that streaks into and blasts into the harpy, wobbles in the air for a second. The energy explodes and is now spinning, keeping this weird shifting, like an atom spin around the outside of its body. The next attack has advantage because of Guiding Bolt. It's looking pretty hurt, too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Show off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes Caduceus's round.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it carrying our deckhand over open water now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, not yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha's turn. Yasha-- it just grabbed him and is trying to pull away. Yasha's-- I don't think Yasha's close enough to hit and melee it, it pulled him up too high.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "Throw the sword," no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, she's not going to do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that's not happening. There's not much Yasha can do right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can she jump and swing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not really. Sorry. Yasha's going to get underneath though, and prepare in case it does get knocked down a peg or whatever, just gets the sword at the ready and is eyeballing it angrily, and is going to rage because that's fun. All right, that brings us to Nott and Fjord.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will fire at the thing. With my crossbows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do have disadvantage though, because it's out of your firing range, although you can probably move up closer and get within range. It's up to you, you can do that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The deckhand one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, there's only one left, right? No? Maybe?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think so, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, there's one left.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I only rolled an 11.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But you also have advantage because it's got Guiding Bolt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that helps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 does hit, but--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, well that's even better, 17 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sneak attack, because it's-- no, it's holding the friend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not technically -- it's holding, yeah, and it's not even an ally who's in combat with it, so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's an employee. Seven points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven points of damage, all right. (arrow sound) Still flying.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll shoot again, one more time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on, come on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 18 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Only eight more points of damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's pretty good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And all out of hit points. So (arrow sound) the second one, you watch as it goes (pained sounds) and it begins to just careen down towards the edge of the ship.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about to slam-- we'll see, there's a percentage chance here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, percentage dice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it hits on the deck.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 50% chance of either. It crashes in to the other guy, slams in to the side of the railing, manages to pull free and catches up with the other guy as they both run inside the ship. At this point, the other harpies now are just--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bugging out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bugging out and fleeing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Threats are all gone more or less?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the moment-- by the time your spell would wear off, there are none to be seen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I hang from my rope that I was holding on to and slowly start casting Mending on the sail?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, smart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb clutches his chest and cries out and falls to the floor of the boat. (gasping)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no, it's his condition!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (shouting) What's wrong with Caleb?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a heart condition!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Since when?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He always has had one since he was a boy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you have any medicine for him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes! He needs mouth to mouth resuscitation.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, get at it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, no, no. My mouth is too small for a human jaw to make perfect contact.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just cup his nose, just (breathes).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I can't get my mouth wide enough, too many teeth are in the way!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll do it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That would be good, you or Beau really.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I drop down. I have, like, really good medicine training.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (exhaling heavily)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Well Caleb, just for the sake of it, roll a deception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "Ja, sure."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just out of curiosity.

lines.text: Go ahead and make a general medicine check.

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (owl hoot)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good to keep that in mind. As you bring your things in for the evening, that comes to a close; your second full day of travel, now the following morning, comes to bear. Who's keeping watch for this day?

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you just begin to Decompose.

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next evening? All right, go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. Okay. Make your survival check for me as the captain, please. With advantage, because you have Orly on board.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: okay, uneventful. At one point you pass by a few small rock islands, bits of stone that are breaking through the surface, too far away to make any details. They're not large; one set appears to be maybe ten, 12 feet across, the other one looks to be about 40 or so feet across. Just little breaks in the water, where a little mass of stone has breached, but that's all you can make out. The evening goes by, uneventful. By the third day, the morning comes around, Orly comes up to the top, comes to you and goes, "Excuse me, Captain. I'm keeping tabs on our travels southward, I can see "the reef is approaching."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Excellent. (laughter) Well, let's prepare to navigate through it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Such captaining.

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are different-- see those Y marks? Each one of those is going to be a survival check to try and maneuver the boat through the reef.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we get advantages on those or something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, because you have Orly with you, and Orly is working with you side by side, holding up the map and looking at the scenery. A lot of the crew's on the deck as well keeping eyes out.

lines.name: LIAM, SAM
lines.text: The dodecahedron!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah, yeah! Focus on this, Fjord!

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have your Fragment of Possibility.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: These are survival checks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, with advantage. For the first one--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's the first sign you see of one of those points.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (pirate voice) Dead men tell no tales.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You and Orly both, going through and traversing this, you can see the next path before you. Both of you together, go ahead and make another survival check with advantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right then. As you make your way through the next portion of the reef, turning it over, you hear it impact a heavy portion of the reef, scraping across it. The ship's hull does take damage.

lines.text: Gallan, go! Go fix it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: reef. Looking behind, you can see parts of it that are broken and falling in and pieces of wood that have been dragged off and splintered. The crew rushes down inside and making an investigation check-- pretty high-- they do not see any damage to the hull that's taking on water, but that was not a happy thing. You do not know how many more of those type of hits you'll take before the ship begins to take on water and they can't do repairs to the hull unless it's in a port of some kind.

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to stay down where it was and cast Mending as much as possible.

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just in case. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keeping low. All right, so that's the second one. You're marking each of these that you pass by?

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're on the third.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and try again now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
