lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! The channel you've made your way through in the reef is getting narrower and you can see elements of the reef are beginning to vanish into just jutting pieces of stone. It looks like, in a weird way from a distance, like a series of gravestones. Familiar to you as you pass by as bits of rock are breaking the surface, some at odd angles and there were semblances of stone spires that naturally jut from underneath the water that the reef is built on over time. The channel gets thinner here, but thankfully after that last hit, you dig deep in yourself and be like, "No, I've seen ships go through this, I'm getting the feel for this whole captain thing," and between you and Orly communicating, you manage to just make it through the channel. At a point, all of you hold your breath as you see elements of the reef that should be wide enough to put maybe a ship that's slightly larger than the one you have in, but with even just a small narrow margin of failure here, you would've ground against the side of one or the other side. You cut straight through perfectly, balancing on both sides, coming past the third marker beneath the surface, this one breaking through about a foot past the water. As you spin around, you guys begin to just barely see the shadowed landmass of an island beginning to appear as your destination. As you come to the final portion of the reef's channel, go ahead and make your final check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come on, Tusktooth!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. You come through the last portion of this. It's a very tight location and you and Orly look back and forth. You may have been a little off in the portion of the reef you thought you were supposed to take through this broken channel and as you do-- it seems fine, and you're looking at the front of the ship, a bunch of them gathered at the bow, and look over, both on port and starboard side and go, "I think we'll be all right!" (crashing)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.text: This is less of just mending a small object; this is structural hull damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A single break or tear in an object you touch. Mending is not going to help you with this.

lines.text: Gallan and anybody who wants to come help, the hull is now taking on water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check real fast as you glance around the chamber.

lines.text: Nothing comes to mind, looking around. You're kind of panicking. All the rest of the crew are suddenly coming down they're starting to get a bucket chain, trying to just get water out of there as they have no idea at the moment. Gallan gets his tools, starts looking around for whatever scrap materials they had purchased. You're now an inch of water in the bottom of the ship. Anyone else doing anything to help here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Some barrels. Come on, captain, tell us what to do!

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I miss my druid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Yasha goes and grabs the other side of the barrel and both of you go try and force and hold it there.

lines.text: All right. How much time?

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you to go ahead and make a strength check, with Yasha's help, with advantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Goddamn it, really? 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (bursting water) You're holding it there but it's spraying around the edges. The barrel immediately fills, and you're now trying to cork the hole with this barrel and it's just (spraying sounds) all around you--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fjord, go swim down on the outside and plug it from the outside. Go!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: With what?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bring something!

lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Some pieces of wood!

lines.text: Do we have a mattress or something like that? Do we have anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're less mattresses in the ship. There are cots. There is actually a mattress in the captain's quarters. There's the one mattress.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure, I'll drag that out and jump over the side and try and push up against the hole.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's fabric!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is that what you're doing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to join you and tie ourselves off and I'm going to also cast Water Walk if you're into it on--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm thrilled. We can still go underwater though, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, and you can walk on the surface if you choose to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I should probably not do this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll go up there and hold that safety line that you were talking about.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've got Water Walk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I throw the mattress in, I jump in after it, and I try and go under--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can stand on the surface and then, below--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a suction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get below and you get the mattress-- what do you do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I press it against the outside of the ship and hope the current (suctioning).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make a perception check because it's under the water and you're not entirely certain where-- there's a large scrape section where a lot of the reef pulled against the hull.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20, yeah. Glancing down, as you're about to go help, you look and you can see, of all the damage that's taken that's superficial, there's one section where it looks like a heavy groove is carved out from that last impact, and there you can see this faint shift of the water pouring through that gap. You take and hold down the mattress and it pulls against it. It's there in place-- the suction's holding it. You're not sure how long it'll hold there without anything holding it in place.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to run down below and-- all right, fix it! Fix it, now! Got to get it up! I start trying to pull the barrels apart--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gallan, at this point, has his tools and starts handing out nails left and right. He brought an additional set of tools so two of you can--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm also going to cast Light in there to make it super, super light.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While you're brightening that, Gallan's over there. He's hammering in the nails--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two barrels down, pulled apart to get materials to try and patch this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm still part of the water bucket brigade.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Correction for me, not 11 minutes, 20 minutes. Still doing it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm on the top of the-- crow's nest? Is that what it's called?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Crow's nest is the very top.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As far away from the water as possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. "Looking good!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, great. You're there. Because the ship is still moving, you're having to hold it in place while walking on the side. It seems to be holding itself okay for the time being, just from the pressure of the water, but it's starting to slide off as it goes. It's a weird scenario where now that it's blocking the section, there's no suction, there's just the pressure of the water, but as it moves it is sliding along with it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take the sword, shove it-- no, I'm just kidding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Jester, you're helping out with the repairs? Make a general d20 check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Two.

lines.name: MATT, MARISHA
lines.text: Aw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh! Natural 20 on Gallan's turn. If you needed that any time, it's fucking now!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, Gallan!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One by one, begins taking the best parts of the barrel that Yasha helped him break, begins holding it in place. "Hold this here!" He starts nailing it down. Eventually, over the 20 or so minutes it takes for him to cast the spell, he patches it in a way where he's like, (Scottish accent) "This will "hold for a little bit. But we're going to have--" Why'd I go Scottish there for a second? "This will hold for a little bit. I don't know how long. We're going to have to figure out some way "to fix this, get it to shore, or something."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, of course.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sighs) "Okay."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I say from outside the boat: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're walking alongside the boat, it's going to pick up speed a little bit here. You're going to have to either have to let this mattress go or find a way to keep it in place. What are you going to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll let it go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The mattress slides away and you see water (spraying). It's a slow leak. It is still taking on water, but slowly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a patch job. When Caleb returns, he can tell us what the fuck he was planning with the spell.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll tug on the line and get myself pulled back up into that boat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're taking on water?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god. We have to-- anything non-essential just throw overboard!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We got to get the crow's nest out of the boat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, everything overboard. Everything! The sails, everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The crew now rapidly getting the water out of the bottom of the cargo hold. They're throwing it overboard. You gather with the slow leak, in the next couple hours they'll be able to minimize the amount of water that's below there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look like there's a little island nearby?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, we've done the final turn, so we could try and push towards the island, but we're going to have to beach it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are now turning towards the island and it's an open bay now. You passed the reef, and you're heading towards the island of Urukayxl.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there anywhere that looks like a dock, or anywhere that looks like it's appropriate to--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I am. I think that's right, 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 26. No dock, but you do see another ship.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's your spell do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was your spell doing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm making the tiny hut, but I don't know how much time has passed while I was peeing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 minutes as they've try to makeshift plug the hole. It's a slow leak still, but they've managed to hold it off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A ten-foot radius, immobile dome of force springs into existence around and above you and remains stationary for the duration. Environment or weather can't get in, so that's up to you if the ocean can get in or not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will say if you choose not to let the ocean in, it will not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is totally transparent. All of us can look through it and see into the ocean.

lines.name: SAM, LIAM
lines.text: Glass bottom boat!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long will it stay?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eight hours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nice. Long enough for us to patch it up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can certainly, 20 minutes in advance, get it going again. As long as I can focus, indefinitely.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've approached the island. We have another boat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How do you want to play this?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's another boat. Are we making ourselves known or are we not making ourselves known?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Off to the side. Park it away from the other boat.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But I think it's daytime, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If we can see them, they can see us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How far away is the other boat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say it's--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it possible they haven't seen us yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're about maybe-- as you're breaking past the reef, they're a few miles away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would it be reasonable to think they've seen us by this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's possible. If you can see them with your naked eye, there's a chance they've seen you, but you don't know. You have no way to confirm that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look like they're coming or going from that island?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just noticed them, you don't see any motion yet. You'd probably have to try and gauge it over a period of time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will try to increase our speed towards the island in the direction away from them and aim to get on the island, if we can.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keeping watch as you're shifting around. Are you going south or north side? You're heading south towards the island as you went through the reefs, so now you're on the northwestern side of the island.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It just depends on where the ship was, if it was directly ahead of us or towards the north or the south, we'd obviously go the opposite way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, it's a little bit north of where you're headed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to the southern tip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're cruising, and you're keeping an eye closely you watch as the ship was stationary begins to move in the direction you're traveling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to ground this ship. We're going straight into the beach and we're going to run our asses into the fucking jungle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How will we get back?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know. We're not there yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You are a terrible captain.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I throw Nott overboard. Full sail!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I grab her and bring her back. No, I'm just kidding.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know that video of the monkeys throwing the raccoon?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what I imagined.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In pushing the ship ahead as fast as you can with the hole plugged, towards the south side of the island in the attempt to beach it, as you continue the ship is moving to head you off at the pass.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually you start getting a closer look at it, and it's a bigger ship than the one you have now. It's dual mast.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. Does it have some trap doors on the side of the--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look and you don't see any, and then you do because one of them opens. You watch as one of the gun ports (popping).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to raise the flag?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, why not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What flag do we have?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The white flag.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The blue flag.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've got the gray wave one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, as you get situated, you hear (cannon explosion) (water splashing), but a ways away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a warning shot!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It is a warning shot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Raise the flag!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I rose it, it's been risen. It is risen.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I use Mask of Many Faces to make myself look like Captain Jawgrasp. You, lower the flag and-- hmm. Fuck, I don't know. Jesus Christ.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's tough being the smart one, eh?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, no more Grog.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Be bold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're just going to keep driving towards the island.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to keep going?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (excitedly) Yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far are we? That's another question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh you're probably, at this point, about a mile and a half, two miles.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh no no, nevermind. No. We'll slow down the ship a little.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's quite a distance from the island, you notice it as you go to move. It's quite a ways.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, yeah. We'll lower the flags, slow the ship.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You slow the ship-- do you come to a stop?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The ship, you bring it slowly down. Do you drop anchor?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb? I want to talk about mutiny.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're watching off to the side, you can see all the gun ports are open now. But you see two smaller boats that are now coming towards you from the other ship. You can see two separate small crews that are rowing in your direction.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cool. Let's lower the rope ladder over the side and welcome them aboard.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You could technically stand and offer, I might add. Since you can actually stand on water.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can stand on water right now..

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I don't know if he did that, so let's not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The other ship has maneuvered up to the point where it is now, its full starboard side is facing you, full gun ports open. You're in a bad position.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there anything in the sails? Any flags, iconography?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is one sail that is currently partially unfurled. But from this distance it looks like it's facing away from you, from the direction you're looking, so you can't make out any details on it. But there is some sort of stitching in it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We do have his flag up, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you do have the ship's flag up above the Mistake. As these row boats steadily make there way towards your ship, the moment of possible parley approaching, we're going to end the episode there. We'll pick up there for our live show in New York next week.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Boats!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Boats in New York.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Weren't we on boats for our first Gen Con liveshow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you guys were in the Feywild. You fought a feymire crocodile there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just lost the southern tip.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just the tip.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy, does that mean we all need to wear sailing clothing to our show in New York?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) You should, Sam.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh man.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's actually a good thing. We were trying to figure out what to wear!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've been having that discussion about what to wear.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes! Ooh! Could we all get sailor's costumes with the bell bottoms?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can the ladies be pirates?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It can't be hard--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fleet week!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Careful, guys, you're making promises the internet live right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll figure something out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Call a rental house.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was going to say we could also get some blue bell bottoms and some Japanese school tops and fake it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I know you can two-day ship any type of--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Costume on Amazon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Especially ones that look like for sex role play. You can get tons of those.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know what video very specifically--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You heard it here. Next week in New York, live on stage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Live sex. Live sailor sex!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's the pilot--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was going to say, it was the high school pilot outfit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know exactly what you're talking about.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your shipping dreams and your shipping dreams are coming true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On that note, guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you, Backblaze!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you guys for coming along with us for a crazy nautical adventure this week.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [music]
